questionsData.title: An alkali has salty taste.
"Corrode" means "build".
Lenses are especially-shaped pieces of glass.
Vacuum is the source of sound.
Doctors first diagnose an illness then treat it.
"Complete" and "total" eclipse are the same.
Twins are two people with different ages.
The peak of the mountain is its highest part.
The sound of the cow is called cackling.
Antonyms are words with different meanings.
"Recover" means "to become unhealthy".
"Elderly" means "younger than".
questionsData.explain_answer:
No, that's incorrect. "Elderly" actually means "old" or "of advanced age". It's the opposite of "younger than".

  • Elderly: Refers to someone who is old or in their later years.
  • Younger than: Compares two ages, indicating that one person is younger in comparison to the other.

questionsData.title: "Kph" is kilometer per second.
"Opportunity" and "chances" are synonyms.
"Unfilled job" means "vacancy".
"Yours sincerely" comes at the end of the letter.
To make compound word is to separate two words.
Belt is a kind of long thin strip of rubber.
Cabin is a part of a ship.
Sailors are people who work in planes.
questionsData.explain_answer: Sailors are people who work on ships or boats.

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about …………….
questionsData.article: Flu, short for influenza, is a virus (that 3) passes easily from person to person. Every year, millions of people (miss 1) work and school because of the seasonal flu. Seasonal flu exists worldwide. Usually the flu season is in the winter months, but in warm climates, the flu occurs during the rainy season. Flu symptoms include fever,cough, sore throat, body aches, headaches, chills and fatigue. These symptoms usually show up quickly, developing within three to six hours of exposure to the virus. With the flu, you may start the day feeling fine, only to end up feeling (terrible 2) a few hours later. The flu is especially dangerous for children aged two and under, adults over 65 years old, and people in poor health. These people may not be able to fight the virus and can become extremely sick. Therefore, scientists must develop new vaccines each year. It can take six months to a year to develop these vaccines. For some viruses, there is no vaccine, and flu is one of these viruses.

questionsData.title: They only need……. sugar.
questionsData.explain_answer:
We have only little sugar.

  • Few is used for countable nouns, but sugar is an uncountable noun (you can't say "one sugar" or "two sugars").
  • Many is used for a large quantity of countable nouns.
  • Much is used for uncountable nouns.
  • Little is used for small quantities of uncountable nouns, which is perfect for this situation where you have a small amount of sugar.

questionsData.title: One of the following is a compound word.
I don't like cold drinks in winter. The word "drinks" is a / an…..
The suffix…… makes the words " enjoy" an adjective.
Sami is more ……than his friend.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The best correct option is Diligent.

  1. Slim: If you choose this option, the sentence would be: "Sami is more slim than his friend." However, the word "slim" implies physical appearance, and it might not be the most relevant or meaningful comparison for the context. It's more common to use "slimmer" instead of "more slim" when comparing two people's body shapes.

  2. Good: This option means that Sami is better overall than his friend in some way, but it's more common to say "Sami is better than his friend" instead of "more good."

  3. Smart: This option suggests that Sami is more intelligent or has better mental abilities than his friend, but it's more common to say "Sami is smarter than his friend" instead of "more smart."

  4. Diligent: This option implies that Sami is more hardworking and puts more effort into his work or responsibilities compared to his friend.
